website_summaries.verdict: From its breathable and stylish upper fabric to its rugged soles, this is the kayaking shoe to get if you want the best.
pros: For both men and women, in a variety of colors and styles
Breathable upper, with a flexible yet rugged rubber sole
Most find the fit to be perfect
Dries quickly thanks to drainage holes
cons: A number of owners express concern about the grip on wet surfaces, particularly smooth rocks

customer_reviews.title: Really good use for Lakes or Rivers
customer_reviews.text: These are really good for use on lakes or rivers, it gives your bottom feet good protection when stepping on edged small to medium rocks, the top side that covers your foot is of soft spandex material, giving you that really comfortable tight feel overall and the bottom rubber is really flexible. I am size 8 in U.S.A, when i tried it on it was about 1/4 of an inch over my toe, the good part is that they let you return your items for free. I ended up getting the 7.5 U.S size and fitted perfectly. I also got a pair for my wife and she really liked them.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Size matters
customer_reviews.text: I normally buy size 9 or 9.5 depends on a brand but since I won’t be wearing socks, I went with 8.5 but still full one size big and narrow. Pro: good traction, sharp looking water shoes and great for beach activities. Con: size, one size too big and narrow. Not good for wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: Yong Cho

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: so far so good we will see if they last during my vacation. Update: After wearing them to Natural Bridge Caverns, Sea World, Aquatica, and the beach. I have to say I love them. They held up well they do trap sand inside your shoe but sand gets everywhere any way. They had great grip walking up and down the steep inclines at the caverns and protected my feet at the water park. the only thing the mess insole was not pleasant to walk on after a while and I ended up wearing socks with them everywhere but the beach and water park.
customer_reviews.author: HannahPilar

customer_reviews.title: Well-made.
customer_reviews.text: These water shoes are very well-made. They don't shift around like a lot of other water shoes I've had. They seem to be slip-resistant, but they do not have the Vibram logo on them. I usually wear a women's size 7.5, but since they were no half sizes listed, I ordered a half size up. I wish I would've known that they were actually European sizes because I would have gotten a size 38, which fits me well, instead of a 39. I gave them 4 stars because they are a little tight from top to bottom, so those with thicker feet may find them a little tight from top to bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for beach & water activities
customer_reviews.text: Picked up a pair for my trip to Punta Cana. They are good beach/water shoes. Wore them into the water and they hold up well against the salt water. The elastic laces makes the shoe fit to the contour of your feet. The holes in the sole padding and rubber sole definitely helps with draining out water quick & dries fast. I cant speak for grip of the shoes as I only used them on the beach. The shoes definitely outranks the other pair I had purchased and fell apart from the salty water of the beach. I would recommend these if you're looking for good beach water shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Herman L.

customer_reviews.title: Not for walking on river rocks but comfy overall.
customer_reviews.text: Order 1/2 size up if you have a wide foot as these guys are tight! I just got these for a river trip & was so excited as they were so comfy & seemed to have good bottom grips BUT...got to river (1st time to wear them) and the adjusting cord ripped. The shoe was already on and I went to adjust the strap a little tighter and the cord ripped out of holder. Also, maybe because they were new the bottoms slipped on river rocks making it difficult to manage through at times. Otherwise, they fit comfortable, look great and are snug but maybe not good if you know you have to walk over wet rocks.
customer_reviews.author: @food_gypsy

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Both shoes broke as soon as I tried them on. In one case the pull tab on the tongue of the shoe snapped off. On the other, the lace came out from the plastic piece where both laces are attached. You can see in the picture where I tied a knot to the end that came loose.
customer_reviews.author: SKis_CO

customer_reviews.title: Very nice looking/feeling shoes
customer_reviews.text: Got these for lake swimming due to rocks. Very nice looking/feeling shoes, but order half a size down. I am almost always an 8.5 women's (and my husband is an 8.5 men's), but we both had to order half a size below (8 women's/men's, respectively).
customer_reviews.author: sophist015

customer_reviews.title: Shoelace broke & slippery soles. Get Keen Sandals instead.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use for river tubing in Costa Rica. The shoe lace on one shoe ripped out of the plastic pull tab during the first use. The grip on the soles isn’t very good. I was slipping during the hike to the river and also walking through the river. This is my 2nd budget water shoe purchase and I haven’t been happy with either. My recommendation is to spend more money and get Keen sandals. My fiancée bought Keens and they worked perfectly for water activities and hiking. It’s worth the extra cost to have a high quality product that won’t break or cause you to slip around. Wish I would’ve done that from the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Emil

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes! Got these for Conquer the Gauntlet (4 ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! Got these for Conquer the Gauntlet (4 mile mud run with obstacles) and they worked perfect. Can't beat the price! I feel like they run a little big (I got 9.5, should have probably got 9) if you want to wear them barefoot. I ended up keeping them because I didn't have time to exchange them and they stayed on my feet the entire race and didn't rub or anything. These are pretty cute as regular athletic shoes as well, I've worn them to the gym a couple times and love them. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Julia Engle

customer_reviews.title: Beware shoe ink tatoos on your skin
customer_reviews.text: I got the shoes yesterday just in time for my fishing trip so I was able to wear them for 10 hours straight and by the time I got home and took them off the ink one the show’s tattooed onto my feet and it took me over an hour to scrub it lighter on my skin which is still there. Not happy about how my feet look like now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very slippery on wet ground
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for a vacation trip to a beach resort. I tried them on for the first time in the pool area and they were extremely slippery. I was much better off with bare foot or wearing my regular sandals (which are not designed for slippery ground). They are supposed to have a good grip which is not the case but the opposite. Needless to mention I didn't wear them at all after that. They look and feel nice though. The material doesn't seem high quality, they probably won't last more than a few days of regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Gomez Rivero

customer_reviews.title: FIt great (normally wear an 8 and ordered the 7) and ...
customer_reviews.text: FIt great (normally wear an 8 and ordered the 7) and dry fast! Highly recommend! I wore these on our river kayaking adventure and they never slipped and I never got rocks in my shoes. With my old water shoes, I was constantly taking them off to get the sand, rocks, etc out of them. However, the little rubber pull tab at the top of the tongue of the shoe broke the first time I pulled it, so don't use it to pull your shoe on.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Okay for price, but narrower and longer than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear to the beach and to potentially use at waterparks, when kayaking, etc. I typically wear a size 13 in sneakers and boots, but sometimes will need a 13 Wide, for dress shoes. I find these to be super narrow at the arch and probably a half size longer than my typical size 13 shoes. Before these, I've always bought Speedo or Body Glove brand water shoes / aqua socks and have always loved the fit and quality of those. That said, I went with the "Shamrock Green" color and have received lot of compliments on the color. But, for overall comfort and quality, I think there are better options out there.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos R.

customer_reviews.title: Die runs everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Like the look, color and at first Hight the fit was good. About a size big and I have big feet. But 2 things to be aware of, I was in salt water and 2nd day paddle boarding and there was all this purple doe all over my board and then on my legs after sitting cross legged. The material the os black at the back completely released die and I had a hard time getting it off my leg and my feet I need to scrub really hard. Also not good for paddling and when on knees, the plastic clip to tighten the top straps really hurts the top of your feet. I won’t be wearing these again.
customer_reviews.author: HeathersATL

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Poor durability with a horribly undersized product, buyer beware. Pull tabs broke with first use.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Toebe

customer_reviews.title: Too bad because the shoes are really nice and think they ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are HUGE! I normally wear a 7 1/2 but half sizes were not available. Others had said the shoes run a bit large so I ordered a 7. But the shoes extended a full inch beyond my big toe! They had to have been marked wrong and would guess they were at least a size 8. Too bad because the shoes are really nice and think they would hold up well. Had to return. Not sure I dare try ordering a smaller size or reorder another 7 and see if. The fit is better.
customer_reviews.author: Diana P

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP MATERIAL
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son to wear at the pool this summer. Although comfortable and super cute, they do not last long. A month in there are holes on the top where the big toe is on both shoes! Not worth the price. If I have to replace them each month of the summer it's probably a little more economical to buy a good pair that will last throughout the summer months.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I really really loved these shoes! They fit like a sock - I normally wear a 7 and I ordered a 7. They're lightweight and have great traction on the bottom. The only problem was the lining on the inside sole. It was bumpy and hurt my feet just walking a few steps around the house. A smoother inside lining would make these shoes perfect! Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: R8V10

customer_reviews.title: Like barefoot water shoe
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have only used once, Use was for sailing. It is much like being barefoot but bottom of foot protected. Tread on bottom was sufficient enough that I never felt anything when walking on the ocean floor. Keep in mind that my walking was mostly over a sandy/muddy bottom. The shoes stayed in place well which is a huge advantage. My reason for 4 stars & not 5 is that these may not be sufficient for walking on harsher surfaces. We have many oyster beds here and I would prefer more protection around the edges of my foot for oystering. But for sailing and general water use, these are very nice so far. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Liked the fit and appearance
customer_reviews.text: We love these shoes because they cuddle the foot in a very comfortable way. We used them during a canoeing trip that involved walking in dry and wet sand. I also kept them on when I went swimming; they protected my feet when walking on rocks and seashells. Remember when you wash them to take the insole and shake it vigorously to get rid of any sand particles or tiny rocks/shells that got stuck in the holes. If you don't do that this could cause holes and eventually tear up the shoe. Very good quality and comfortable. Lots of colors to choose from. The hubby and the wifey each got a pair and we both were very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: tjmm5

customer_reviews.title: Run big, but would purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: Deducting due to the sizing being a little large. I’m normally a 9.5 and I’m pregnant (so my feet swell) but after reading reviews, I still ordered 9.5. They weren’t too big that you couldn’t walk in them but they folded funny in the back because of extra sole sticking out. Otherwise, they worked perfect for boating, hiking, swimming in lake. I would purchase again in a heartbeat, just in a smaller size. I like that the band around ankle isn’t too tight on these, like some others that I’ve tried out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job
customer_reviews.text: These work well for creek walking shoes. They feel a tad tight when you first put them on, but they stretch out quickly. So far they are holding up to all the miles I've put on them. If you're going to be walking in a lot of sand you might look elsewhere. Sand easily gets in behind your heel and then under your heel. I'm taking them off quite often to clean the sand out.
customer_reviews.author: shotgunmik

customer_reviews.title: Will turn your feet black!!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely can not recommend. I’ve used them on one beach walk and one paddle board ride and there are already holes in the toes. The “laces” are very uncomfortable when you’re sitting on your feet to get on the board. And the backs have dyed my heels completely black. This picture is after an hour in the shoes and a very vigorous scrub in the shower to try and remove the color.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie E. St

customer_reviews.title: Good design but cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoe design, however, one pull of the string to tighten it an BAMB....BROKEN (China) The arch support is lacking stability and there's slack in the shoe in the ankle location like the bottom is fitted differently than the outer shoe cover. Going to return for a second pair and try my luck again. Update: decided to give them a try....however, first time down the rapids and because I was unable to secure my shoe's I lost them. The heel of the shoe doesn't fit snug enough and leaves a gap in the rear.
customer_reviews.author: MITCHELL SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Great "Creek" Shoe
customer_reviews.text: We bought 3 pairs of these shoes for our family so we could safely and comfortably hang out in a nearby creek. These shoes are FANTASTIC. They are comfortable and fun. I also don't need to worry about them coming off and having to chase them downstream because they have the elastic tie. I am usually a size 10 shoe, and they didn't have that option at the time so I ordered up to be safe (10.5). They were too big. So I ordered the 9.5 and they fit just right. At $20, these are wonderful investment for fellow creek stompers.
customer_reviews.author: J.M. DeLong

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size and Runs LARGE
customer_reviews.text: I really like the look and design of the shoe. They are sleek, flexible and comfortable. If they weren't the wrong size I'm sure I would love them... but they're about a size larger than advertised. Also... I ordered a size 4.5 US (womens) and received a size 5 US (womens)... The shoes say size 35 China which converts to a women's 5 in US... so the sizing isn't accurate on the website to begin with. This is particularly unfortunate for me because they don't offer sizes smaller than the 4.5 US (women's) I ordered. So, unfortunately I have to return them and buy shoes from somewhere with more accurate sizing. What a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Monique Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Disgusted
customer_reviews.text: The product was clearly used! How is possible that you not notice that the item is used and still ship it anyways. As soon as I too it out the box, I could see dirt in the bag. When I flipped the item around there was gravel in the grooves of the shoe. The bag even had dirt in it. This is completely unacceptable and unsanitary! I can’t give a review on sizing because I wouldn’t dare stick my foot in a dirty used shoe. I wish I could give it zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine with scuba fins and walking on ocean small lava rocks
customer_reviews.text: These worked really well in Hawaii which means when walking over lava rocks along the waterline. No, I wouldn’t hike in them as they don’t offer ankle support, but anything water is fine. Very good traction for getting in or out of a boat or kayak or even stepped on boulders under water. The best part is the locking mechanism to hold the shoelaces. This was key when putting on blackstrap scuba fins.
customer_reviews.author: Jeep Off-roader

customer_reviews.title: Great, Functional Multipurpose Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these water shoes for kayaking and fishing. So far, they have exceeded my expectations as far as quality and functionality. The quick dry "drain ports" in the soles are great and really prevent your feet from staying soaked while in the shoe. On my most recent weekend kayaking trip, these shoes held up great during my ~6 hours on the river. Great grip on the slick rocks when getting in/out of the water. They are great on land too, as I wore them during my hikes to and from the river. The rubber soles are sturdy enough to prevent sticks from stabbing through and have deep enough treads to keep traction on steep inclines and declines.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron R.

customer_reviews.title: Beware of foot staining
customer_reviews.text: I wore these for 5 hours on a kayak fishing trip. Took them off at the end of day to find badly stained heels that will not clean up even with Isopropyl Alcohol, I like to wear flip flops and will not be able to until these stains to go away. I cannot figure out how to include pictures so if you want to know what they can look like another buyer posted pics of his feet. That will give you an idea. Don't buy unless you want your feet stained.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Rossiter

customer_reviews.title: Great so far - snug and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are a little narrow by normal standards, but I like them that way to ensure they’re snug and comfortable while doing outdoor activities. I am normally a 12 men’s/ 13 women’s, but after reading reviews I bought an 11.5 men’s and it’s about right. I have hammer toes so you can see where my toes end up in the pictures posted. A 12 would probably be too big and the 11.5 is the tiniest bit snug so I’ll stick with the 11.5. At this point in time they fit and feel great. I bought them to go white water rafting and hiking and will update if they don’t work as planned.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Not Anti-slip as suggested
customer_reviews.text: I’m disappointed with these water shoes but I really don’t want to be. Everything was perfect about them until I used them at a water park and slipped on regular gritty concrete. I had to catch myself a few times as I was merely walking. I decided to try again and took them to the springs. I slipped on the stairs going in and actually hurt myself. I hated myself for even giving them that chance when I knew hey had failed me. The treading on the bottom is actually really nice and leads you to believe there is a grip but it’s just an illusion. Be careful, you’ve been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Jes

customer_reviews.title: Impressive comfort & support for a water shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I have never purchased a water shoe but needed one for our upcoming cruise. I normally wear a 9 M or 8.5 W, but based on the reviews saying how large these run, I purchased an 8 and it fits perfectly. The width is very comfortable for my wider feet, the length is absolutely perfect. Best of all, the sole is surprisingly supportive and extremely comfortable to walk in. I almost wonder if I couldn't wear these for moderate walking during the entire excursion, they're so comfy! Highly recommend, pay close attention to the fit reviews and definitely go down either 1/2 or 1 full size from what you typically wear.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M.

customer_reviews.title: You'll want to take these everywhere you go
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of hiking and a huge chunk of where I go involves creeks, rivers, etc and these are perfect. What I like: - fits great and easy on/off (insoles are actually very comfortable and I'm used to dr. shols inserts) - Look amazing and easy cleaning, can wear them into places and around town - very light so i can clip them to the back of my backpack for drying and carrying What I didn't like: - the anti slip figure eight on the bottom is nice but the usual creek slimyness is still slippery so be careful - the bungees on top to tighten are a little long but nothing too bad
customer_reviews.author: JonnyG

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend, but runs a little big!
customer_reviews.text: i usually wear a 9.5 in women’s so that’s what i ordered ... they were a little big! i could have gotten away with 9’s. Despite being big they worked great for my float down a river. A few times the heel part of the shoe slid off but it didn’t bother me. If i was on a trail or had to walk in water for a while these shoes wouldn’t have worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Rips very easily!
customer_reviews.text: They look great and fit well, but ripped very easily. I took them river tubing and after I got out of the water I noticed that there were holes in the toe area and a large rip on the side. I did not even walk through rough areas or feel them scratch on anything.
customer_reviews.author: allen harris

customer_reviews.title: Meh. I expected better for the reviews I saw
customer_reviews.text: So these were very comfortable to wear casually, but the lacing system didn't pull the heel cup into my heel well and they felt loose unless I basically made a tourniquet out of it. Therefore I was reluctant to wear them in any athletic or active duty. The material on the top of my foot tore after very light use around the house. I'd hate to have seen their performance while trail running or climbing. On a positive note... The materials on the sole we're sticky and offered good grip. I got lots of compliments.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Yes but no
customer_reviews.text: I wore these shoes when I went kayaking on a mini vacation. They worked in the sense that I didn't have to step on sharp rocks but I found that they CONSTANTLY got rocks and sand inside of them. If I would've bought a smaller size they would've been uncomfortable and too tight. I would recommend if you're just going to walk on a beach or something maybe even swimming but if you're going to be in anything with fast moving water and lots of rocks steer clear
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Gambino

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, but doesn't wear very well
customer_reviews.text: My husband was excited to use these water shoes. They look good and fit pretty well. They weren't snug and he probably could've sized down another size (we already sized down from his actual shoe size). He wore them once to a water park and used them in a lazy river. He liked the way they felt, but noticed at the end of our visit that there were little holes around the edge of the material where it meets the sides of the rubber soles. He was disappointed in the quality of the shoes. He could use them again, but they look like they've been worn several times instead of once.
customer_reviews.author: Erica A.

customer_reviews.title: Surprising Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying surf shoes for years to wear as house slippers. I usually buy the cheapest ones I can find, because, hey... they keep my feet off of the floor. This year, the season was over before I decided I needed to buy some. So, I came to Amazon to see what I could find. I have a pretty large foot, so these were what I found. When they got here, I put them on, and they are so comfortable! They appear to be very well made, too. These shoes were about twice the price I normally pay for surf shoes, but I STILL think they are a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Dave H.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful shoe but made ankle blister
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable water shoes for coral beaches. Dries really fast. The color is beautiful. Only complaint, I could not tighten my left shoe to avoid it rubbing up and own on the back of my ankle, creating a blister. Only socks could remedy the situation. But, who wants to wear socks at the beach with water shoes?! The right shoe was perfectly fine only the left seemed defective in the heel/ankle stitching. So do wear around the house before venturing out.
customer_reviews.author: china mom

customer_reviews.title: Initial Package Was Exchanged Due To Size Advertised Size Running Too Large.
customer_reviews.text: The resourceful factor was what generated my attention. Upon arrival, I saw the shoes were of thick yet pliable rubber that made ordering a good purchase: except for one aspect, the size. The shoes needed to be exchanged for one size smaller, and has enriched my gym shower experience. ...Maybe ”enhanced” isn't the right word as I still dislike showing outside of my home. ...Whatever, you get the point.
customer_reviews.author: Sage

customer_reviews.title: It was a good fit. The front of the shoe is wider ...
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a men's 7.5 as one foot is a bit larger than the other. Normal men's 7 is too tight for my one foot. Based on reviews I ordered half size smaller than normal. It was a good fit. The front of the shoe is wider than normal. Which I like since I don't like my toes squished together. Based on that I may have been able to go with Men's 6.5. The back part of the shoe seems to be normal width and I'd consider the front to be wide width.
customer_reviews.author: T. Klotzbach

customer_reviews.title: Nice pair of water shoes
customer_reviews.text: Pros: They fit like regular shoes, they stay on in the water, they look great Cons: a little slippery when on wet surfaces Update: 9/25/19 I am changing my review to 5 stars. Here is why. I snorkel frequently, I went on a trip on 9/24, I used the shoes all day and not once did the shoe become loose or uncomfortable. I am extremely satisfied with this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Deano!

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I've yet to do any long term testing but I like these. I bought them as a secondary set of footwear for backpacking. They are light weight and comfortable. I wanted something for crossing rivers and streams and fishing. I also wanted something comfortable to wear around camp after a long day of hiking and these seem to fit the bill. I usually wear a 10.5 and bought a 10 and they fit good if not a little big so I would recommend going a size down from what you usually wear. The stretchy upper provides a comfortable fit that keeps my feet in place and I can slip them on and off without undoing the laces.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost of Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Excellent water shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pairs of these, mostly for my husband and me to climb Dunn’s River Falls in Jamaica. I was very happy with how these looked, the fit, and the functionality of these shoes. They were excellent for climbing the falls, but were great for the beach too. The sole is a little thicker than some other water shoes I’ve seen, but still thin, as they are supposed to be. They have good traction on the bottom. They feel good on your feet. Really, they are very useful for several activities and I’m glad I bought them as I can definitely use them in the future. I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good deck and water shoes
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a pair for a woman and a pair for a man in different sizes and colors. They are roomy in the toe box and fit without sliding off the back of a narrow heel. The sole is thick enough to wear as a street shoe so I don't need to pack extra shoes when at the beach and strolling around town.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Burns

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Love these super light all purpose shoes! Got them for a camping trip up into the Rockies and they were a great buy! Fit snug and have a rigid enough sole that you can literally hike with them in rocky areas with little discomfort. They can be used in water and don't get bogged down with water. They also dry in minutes in the sun. I would have been happy if they just lasted my one rugged trip, but it looks like they still have plenty of life in them. I now just keep these in my truck as backups.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Rod

customer_reviews.title: they were great for my weekend camping trip
customer_reviews.text: I'm taking off one star, because they do not dry quickly. But, they were great for my weekend camping trip. I went hiking in the woods while it was raining and it was perfect. The sole of these shoes are very strong and I still had great support while walking. They were really comfortable. I wear a size 5 and I after reading the reviews about them running big, I got the 4.5. They were right. I was really glad I went down a size (and also, that they HAD the next size down). I probably could have gotten the size 4, but I don't think it would have really made a difference for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for SUPing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these water shoes soon after buying my first stand-up paddleboard. I'd previously been using a comfortable pair of Tevas that are great for getting wet, but not necessarily submerging. These shoes are lighter, have drain holes, and are easy to slip on and off while sitting on my SUP on the lake. They look really cool, and are so light and comfortable that I want to wear them everywhere. Definitely a great price point, too!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Wilson

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoes
customer_reviews.text: My favorite shoes! I have a pair in almost ever color! Comfy, cute, and dry instantly. I wore these when I worked in a restaurant as they fit the color code and they really helped my sore feet. I wear them paddle boarding, hiking, kayaking, grocery shopping, etc. I love them. If they get wet they dry within the hour or in the sun about 10 minutes. They wash nicely in the washer if they get muddy. Overall, my favorite shoes, so worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Madyson McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Still wearing them for a year now!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the river, wading through the creek, and they're comfortable enough for wearing to and from the water activities. The only negative was the elastic tightening strings. I think they only use one length for any size shoes. I wear 10.5 and the elastics were extremely tight on the tops of my feet, so bad that I had to cut them and remove them. The shoes still work without them but it would be nice if I had elastics long enough to adjust to my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Carter

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but durable sole, exceeds my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful shoe for versatility. For packing light (the shoes easily fold up) and can wear as a water shoe or light hiking/walking. Mine will do double duty so I can keep my luggage lighter. I would not want to go a 10 mile hike in them but the sole is thick enough it would probably hold up, but that is not it’s intended design. Keep your expectations in line with the shoe design and you’ll probably be happy. I am very pleased with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: EveS

customer_reviews.title: Not True to Size
customer_reviews.text: Update: Returned the size 7, received size 6 which fits perfectly. My suggestion would be to order a size down from your normal shoe size. I wear a woman's size 7 so that is what I ordered. Shoes don't fit, they're too large. So now I have to take these shoes to a UPS drop off, it would cost me $6.00 to have UPS pick them up! Then I have to reorder a size smaller than I wear. Who said these shoes are true to size!
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: fits near perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I am a size 8.5 and wear a size 9 running shoe. I bought the 8.5 in purple for the pool and they are almost perfect. The size is a good fit and the laces aren't super long or annoying. They also come with a back up clip just in case. My only issue with them is something I don't think the company can fix - the traction at my pool makes me slip all over when I am on the lane line or on tiles walking to my locker. So if you wear them wet on tiles just be very careful.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, Hurts unless you change the Insert
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip and decided to try this out before the trip and found the shoe to be terrible on my feet because there's some terrible nylon mesh material in the insert that digs into your feet. I ended up buying an insert online to replace it, and it became much more wearable. If you want a product you can wear while walking around a water park, this isn't it, unless you're willing to buy a more comfortable insert. The color is nice, and the product looks alright, but the inside mesh on the insert sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Zachare S.

customer_reviews.title: Sizing inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of these that are comfortable but just a bit too small so I ordered one size up, but these new ones are way too big, especially in the width. Though all of these “water shoes” appear to be the same even down to the liners, the sizing between sellers does differ so I guess it’s a hit or miss. These new shoes are okay but not as well fitting as my original pair, even though they do look the same, it’s confusing. The last picture I posted shows the difference between the two, my original pair is on the left.
customer_reviews.author: LMG

customer_reviews.title: Great water shoes for river trip! Buy 'em now!
customer_reviews.text: Loved, loved, loved these! For a prefer-to-be-barefoot 40-something year old, these were super comfortable to wear for several hours at a time. And that's saying something, because many shoes cause me issues (bunions, flat arches, etc.) Worked well for moving around at the river, tubing, and post-tubing walk on concrete. Feet sank into 6-8 inches of river-bottom mud & shoes stayed put, no issues. Rinsed out easily. Exactly what water shoes should be.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lippenholz

customer_reviews.title: The most amazing water shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I wore them when walking on the rocks and in the water and these made it so easy to get around. On wet and dry rocks the bottoms give enough grip to feel secure climbing the rocks, as they are kind of studded almost like soccer cleats. In the water they still have the same grip while not letting your feet get poked by anything sharp. On wet algae covered rocks there is still some slip, but less so than if I was barefoot.
customer_reviews.author: Emily DeLuca

customer_reviews.title: Cute and Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my job where I am in and out of the water all the time and I needed a shoe with good tread and that was comfortable to wear. I’ve tried heavier duty water shoes in the past and didn’t like them. These fit nice and are soft on your feet. I am not 100% satisfied with the traction they provide but it’s not bad and it’s definitely better than being barefoot. I would recommend them to someone needing some quality made water shoes.
customer_reviews.author: K. Olivia. S

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than you'd expect
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are much more comfortable than I expected and because of the stretchy mesh upper structure, they match their shape to my feet. I've worn them all day without any discomfort or chafing, but I have not yet worn them in water, so that may make a difference. The insert is a bit rough in texture, but not enough to irritate my feet. They seem a bit large, but that's because I'm not wearing socks with them (so order with that in mind). Perfect for water sports!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: The shoes came packaged nicely. No damage, no smell and nothing was missing. I received the shoes I ordered. Arrived on time. The shoe is a little more snug that I expected. I did order the size I usually wear. 7.5. But they are not so tight that I can't wear them. I have not used them yet for the intended purpose and the shoes will most likely stretch with more use. I intend to use them for kayaking. I am hoping they last b/c any other shoe I have bought for water usage have not lasted beyond the summer season.
customer_reviews.author: Marlina Reese

customer_reviews.title: Size runs a little large recommend ordering 1/2 size smaller than you normally wear
customer_reviews.text: The shoes run a little large. I normally wear a men’s 8.5 and ordered that size. The shoes were about a 1/4 to 1/2” too long. I returned the 8.5 and ordered an 8. The 8 fit perfectly and was snug enough that I had no worry that they might come off. The sole is a little slippery initially. They have a removable insole and dry quickly. Shoe performed well over three days of beach and water park use.
customer_reviews.author: MDepuydt

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes but sizing is an issue
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son and they seem really nice, but they were a mile too big. He wears a 10 1/2 men's so I ordered an 11. Those were huge so I sent them back and ordered a size 10. Those arrived and were still huge (probably as big as the size 11 I sent back). So I returned them for a refund and am going to look elsewhere. Just seems like there might be a size consistency problem which is unfortunate because my son really liked them, but I'm tired of the back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Frequent Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but big.
customer_reviews.text: THESE RUN LARGE! I wear a 11 ladies and ordered by the shoe size and there is to much room at the back-(this makes it so sand can sneak in, and so uncomfortable) I LOVE the shoes just not sure if one size smaller would work. Went to make exchange and that’s not a option so I have to order the exchange at full price. $8. more now than my sale price. I would review higher if I could exchange for same price.
customer_reviews.author: Brendy

customer_reviews.title: Grip no slip
customer_reviews.text: Very high-quality and they work great. I could walk in a river on rocks and they have great anti-slip soles. They also work great on my paddleboard. I did not slip off. They dry quickly and I would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I am genuinely surprised and happy with these water shoes. I guessed on size. I was lucky! I would use these in fins to scuba dive. Not what I bought them for though. I purchased them as quick and convenient footwear. I may purchase another pair even though I don’t need more. I love the look too. I had 3 people compliment them today. First time I wore them. These will be worn regularly daily. Try them?
customer_reviews.author: William Hertsenberg

customer_reviews.title: Cormortable and good grip!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to go on beach, snorkel and hike vacation. They were super comfortable to wear on the beach, snorkeling, climbing wet rocks, hiking through trees and vegetation .... and love the look of them with my suit too! They drain well so your feet don't stay wet. I noted a few comments about the shoes not having a good grip. As long as I wasn't walking on algae-covered rocks, they did great. Beach sand didn't get into the edging of the shoe which can rub and cause blisters. I did have to rinse the shoes 2 or 3 times to get allot of the sand out when I was done, but all in all this shoe ROCKS!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a water shoe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace a pair of water shoes I use in an aqua track and for water aerobics. The show is very lightweight. I can see wearing these in the summer instead of going barefoot. I often want to leave the gym with them on. I plan to purchase a pair to wear outdoors as well. I have only used these 4 times in highly chlorinated water, so we’ll see how these hold up from that.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie A A

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: These were a pleasant surprise. I bought them at the last minute for Hawaii because delivery was fast and the were very affordable(cheap). I wore them snorkeling, on a rough and rocky beach and on a 2mile hike to a waterfall in the mud and hilly terrain. They performed great, they were comfortable, supportive and easy to clean. Bought a pair for my wife and grand kids great buy.
customer_reviews.author: jcrow1

customer_reviews.title: A necessity for wet/muddy easy hikes, rocky beaches and boats!
customer_reviews.text: Was my best purchase before a trip to Hawaii. Was perfect for some of the hikes we did on uneven and/or muddy trails or for walking into rocky beaches. We didn’t use hiking shoes at all. Loved that they had laces which made this water shoe feel like a real shoe. The holes allow the water to get out leaving this shoe lightweight (our old water shoes didn’t have this feature). I had purchased the wrong size for my son, and he used “regular” water shoes. There is no comparison. I’ll buy him a pair of these shoes to have for future trips /boat trips.
customer_reviews.author: momOfThreeKids

customer_reviews.title: No rocks in my shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these water shoes for kayaking. I kayak on a river, lots of sandy and rocky beaches we stop at along the way. I wore them two days in a row, not one rock or pebble in my shoes and very minimal sand! These were great! Definitely recommend for casual river days. Not sure they'd be great if you deal with a lot of rushing water as they did slip on my heal a couple of times, but I absolutely loved them for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable + attractive
customer_reviews.text: Water shoes are generally ugly, but these almost look like sneakers so you can wear them all day before you get wet without looking like a dork. They're also comfortable enough to wear all day - though you probably don't want to hike in them (no real arch support). I deducted one star because the plastic eyeholes on the left shoe started to peel away from the shoe after the first week of wearing, so I'm not confident these will be long-lasting water shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: So Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these about a year ago for a cruise trip, where we were traveling to Cozumel, Mexico and I’m glad that I did. The beach was really rocky and people were stepping on pointy rocks and getting their feet stuck in between...me, I was good. I love these shoes! Honestly, I wear these in the summer when it’s raining and I need to run errands. Their very comfortable and sometimes you don’t even notice you have on wet/swim shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Dimplz

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I needed water shoes for an upcoming Labor Day vacation as we will be kayaking/in a lake most of the time. I normally wear a 6.5-7 (6.5 in heels and sandals and 7 in tennis shoes) and I ordered the women’s size 6 - they fit exactly how I want. My toes are just at the tip of the shoe, but the material is stretchy so I can still wiggle my toes. I can’t speak to durability since I haven’t used them yet, but they seem to be of good quality. Will update if they fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight/comfortable water shoes
customer_reviews.text: Nice water shoes! We spend A LOT of time at the river and have several pair of water shoes but my husband wanted something less bulky yet sturdy enough to handle walking on river rocks. We found the quality he's been looking for, in these shoes. They were a little slick at first but nonetheless protected his feet! He says they are very comfortable and lightweight but slightly big. He wears a 10.5 but they didnt have that size so had to buy an 11. We will buy another pair in a 10 and hope they fit better but if not, he says he will do fine with his original pair.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and Breathable
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea. I wore these out playing with the kids in the sprinklers. Protects your feet, great arch support, shoes and feet get wet and then recover and dry quickly. Ran around with the kids on the grass, pavement, through rocks and mud. rinsed them off with the hose after while still wearing them and they were as good as new. Never slipped or got any debris inside of the shoes. Will purchase again if these ever wear out. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: chris j dugan

customer_reviews.title: The fit is excellent
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing. As I am an amputee I don’t have to adjust my foot all of the time when I wear these, and it doesn't affect the alignment. The fit is like a glove. I haven’t gotten in the water but I have worn them on slippery surfaces and they don’t have me holding onto to everything and anything so I don’t fall. The sole is like the sole of a good fitting yoga shoe. I am actually buying them for my grown kids to work out in.
customer_reviews.author: Rockie

customer_reviews.title: Heel is a little wide
customer_reviews.text: I have narrow feet in the back and wide in the front. So I have excess room in the heel area, I could just need a half size smaller. 4 stars because these are the best I found so far, they have lasted longer than the other water shoes of similar style I have found. They keep my feet from getting messed up from soaking in the water for hours and walking in the pool
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: perfect for  what he needs them for
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son for Christmas for when we go fishing on the causeway. They are exactly perfect for what he uses them for. He is 10 years old and fishes about knee-deep in the gulf. They are great from transitioning from water to concrete and sand.
customer_reviews.author: fletchershotmom2010

customer_reviews.title: The best protection for feet swimming or wading through lakes, streams, or ocean surf at the beach!
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy swimming in lakes and streams, these are perfectly light, and durable protection for my feet. I’m very pleased with how they fit, though it’s necessary to use their sizing chart before purchasing. The color schemes are wonderful. They are comfortable as well. A must have for swimming or walking across streams in the wilderness for feet protection. I’m going to purchase more pairs soon. The price is good for the protection they provide.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Fry

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove or so they say
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are like gloves for your feet. They make getting in and out of my kayak so easy while at the lake. I’m never worried about stepping on something since I can’t see the bottom. They are light enough, you will think you can walk on water
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes for everday wearing. They are lightweight, easy fit, and very comfortable. Its like wearing your favorite socks! They’re durable, quick on and off, as well as wasable. If you are using them for water, they do stretch quite abit when wet. I would recommend a size down. They will be tight when dry, but otherwise will remain on your foot in the water. Either way, these shoes perform very well.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to wear, but leaves stains
customer_reviews.text: I got the water shoes to wear while canoeing, and found them very comfortable to wear, much more so than my previous pair. My only complaint is that the dye in the leather around the opening of the shoe bleeds and stains my ankles once they are wet. But the stains aren't permanent, and I'm hoping that with a bit more use, they'll get all that out of their system.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Archerd

customer_reviews.title: Water shoes
customer_reviews.text: These fit on like socks with no arches at all. there are basically socks with a rubberized bottom so you can't feel rocks under your feet. They can be hard to get on and off once they are wet but the fit is fantastic. It becomes part of your foot. It tends to be a little slippery when walking on rocks, however I haven't really found any water shoes that aren't like that. Especially when there is algae and stuff involved.
customer_reviews.author: Cyn

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace my Teva water shoes. Not only do they not make what I had before, but anything that would work was mega bucks, so I took a chance and was pleasantly surprised. Comfortable to walk from car to pool, they fit well (I have a large duck foot so skinny shoes don't cut it). Only thing I would change is the heel sticks out a bit, making it cumbersome to slide pants over. But I like them so much I got a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Pineo

customer_reviews.title: Comfy summer shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I first won these in an Amazon Giveaway, I have since ordered more for the family. They are wonderful. Enough separation from the ground that I can walk easily in stone, rocks without worry, light enough that I feel barefoot. The mesh keeps my feet cool and the holes in the sole allow rapid drying. The mesh can rub a little on the seams if you don't pay attention. Over all i am extremely satisfied!!! August 15th update, hole developed in the toe of one pair, still sooooooo comfy!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: RN and EMT-I

customer_reviews.title: Excellent water shoes for occasional use!
customer_reviews.text: We went white-water rafting on vacation this year, and I needed inexpensive shoes to fit the activity. These fit perfectly, and they were comfortable and secure during all water activities. I also ended up using them in outdoor pools surrounded by blazing hot concrete, speed boats on murky lakes, and a few forays into prickly lawns. The removable insoles and drainage holes dried the shoes quickly. I'd buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Library Chick

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not great
customer_reviews.text: Water drainage is excellent. Fits tightly to foot but not uncomfortably so. The bottom was a little rough on my feet, felt kind of like standing on fishing net. Wasn’t unbearable but not great. There where also a few places where the stitching was a little thick and dug into my heel. If you have sensitive feet I don’t recommend this for you.
customer_reviews.author: BonnieBlu

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I don’t like the way the pool feels on my feet. I put them on with socks just to try them on and I loved them. I actually use them as regular shoes and people just think the are active/rock climbing shoes. I use them for swimming too lol ( no socks) and they work great. They are well built and dry very quickly. I am buying a second pair just to have around. I bought the black ones with the laces, I don’t like the non lace look.
customer_reviews.author: heyjopaul

customer_reviews.title: A very nice product at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised by this product. I’ve spent 5 times this price on water athletic shoes and these totally compare. They fit very well and give decent arch support thanks to the side pulls. Super light weight and quick drying. I bought them for my rowing shell and for kayaking. Couldn’t be happier. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Monsterair

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like these shoes. They're a little big for me, I'm normally a 7 and if I could have gotten these in a 6.5 they would have been perfect. I bought these for kayaking and snokleing river beds. I've used them quite a bit and I like them a lot, especially because of the drain holes. Other shoes that I've worn get so heavy and squishy when using, but the drainage holes on these prevent that. I usually just set them out in the sun to dry completely and so far they've held up wonderfully against the rocks and they dont smell.
customer_reviews.author: Valarie Repp

customer_reviews.title: Great Water Shoes, Terrible Hiking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Relatively comfortable, easy to clean. Excellent for pool/beach use. But stay FAR away if you plan to walk on any type of trail with a slippery surface. I ended up going barefoot for half of the trails just because it was so slippery and dangerous in these shoes. In case the description changes, it previously stated that these are suitable for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: It is a tight squeeze for high arch people, but great otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is a bit thin for high arched feet--which I have. On my first attempt to put them on I found them hard to get on given my high arches, but I quickly became used to that, and after wearing them for two water aerobic classes I have been happy with them. Despite the original difficulty, once on, they worked great for the water aerobics.
customer_reviews.author: MML in SC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes for water activities
customer_reviews.text: The product was true to size, and so comfortable, I kayaked for over 8 hours, not once did I have to readjust my shoes. They had enough sole on the bottom to be comfortable on the hard surface of the kayak, and the bungee "laces" method worked like a dream! The best part was that very minimal sand got inside my shoe. I was ankle deep in sand, when out of the kayak, and I never felt the "need" to empty my shoes out! Fantastic purchase, buying another pair for my daughter!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy with 100% confidence
customer_reviews.text: I'm super impressed with this product. I own Body Glove water shoes and they are far below this product in so many ways. I don't write reviews unless I'm extremely happy with my purchase. If you're looking forward to using there shoes on the beach, particularly those who like the paddle board, kayaking, jet skiing where you'll need wet grip and water drain. These are the best I've used. I will definitely be purchasing additional pairs. Awesomeness!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Makes walking through sand at the beach more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear sandals to the beach but walking from the parking lot to the shore and set up makes it difficult. Sand gets caught in the sandals making every other step uncomfortable. I gave these a try and I am dumbfounded by how I just breeze through and trek through the sand! At first, I was skeptical about the green colored design and style, but it grew on me. My only concern is that I wish they offered half sizes. Other than that, these are worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Lebroski

customer_reviews.title: Great price for this material!
customer_reviews.text: It’s not the best of material as the price is cheaper than comparable products, but it’s doable and does the job. My girlfriend wears it for kayaking, we get in by the rocks, it has a great anti-slip bottom. The only thing is that colors come off sometimes, dying her foot blueish, but it comes right off so not a big deal. It’s stretchable and it’s great for walking on land and in water.
customer_reviews.author: John Maki

customer_reviews.title: Outdoorsy persons dream shoe
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is perfect for people who are outdoorsy. It’s a dream shoe for those people who prefer not wearing shoes! It protects you from the tough environment of the woods, hot sand, oysters, river rocks, hikes, and so much more. My husband and I love these shoes and have used them so many times in the last month and have had nothing but great times. No slipping either! If you need a lot of arch support this may not be the shoe for you but if your not sure, give them a try!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Chandler Denny

product_meta.title: Mishansha Mens Womens Water Shoes Quick Dry Barefoot for Swim Diving Surf Aqua Sports Pool Beach Walking Yoga
feature_bullets: PERFECT MATERIAL:Upper with salt resistance wear resistance stretch breathable ultra light weight Lycra material for fast draining and cross ventilation, give excellent flexible and comfortable.

QUICK DRY WITH DRAINAGE HOLES:Unique and top-quality anti slip camo rubber sole, with several holes on each bottom to ensure proper water flow out of them which creates a cooler and healthier shoe environment
Easy On and Off:The pull tap at the heel allows for quick and easy entry, protecting your feet from dripping off.
ELASTIC STRAPS:According to the width of the foot quickly adjust the shoes elastic and avoid the annoyance of tying your shoes.

IDEAL FOR ANY ACTIVITY:Women and men perfect for beach, swimming, surf, pool, sailing, boating, kayaking, windsurfing, beach volleyball, long airline flight, yoga, performing pilates exercises aerobics etc. The shoe is necessary equipment for vacations.
